ul.li1: 1Say to your brother,Hebrew “brothers” “Ammi,”Ammi means “My people”
and to your sister,Hebrew “sisters” “Ruhamah.”Ruhamah means “Pitied”
2Plead with your mother, plead—
ul.li2: because she is not my wife,
ul.li3: and I am not her husband.
ul.li1: Let her put away her whoring from before her,Literally “from her face”
ul.li2: and her adultery from between her breasts.
ul.li1: 3Lest I strip her naked
ul.li2: and expose her like the day when she was born;
ul.li1: I will make her like the desert
ul.li2: and turn her into parched land;
ul.li3: I will kill her with thirst.
ul.li1: 4And I will not have pity on her children,
ul.li2: because they are children of whoredom.
ul.li3: 5Because their mother was unfaithful;Or “their mother played the whore”
ul.li1: she who conceived them has acted shamefully,
ul.li2: for she said:
ul.li3: “I will go after my lovers,
ul.li1: the ones who give me my bread, my water,
ul.li2: my wool, and my flax,
ul.li3: my oil, and my drink.”
ul.li1: 6Therefore, Look!
ul.li2: I am going to hedge her pathHebrew “your path” with thorns,Literally “with the thorns”
ul.li3: and I will build a stone wall, a stone wall against her,
ul.li2: and she will not find her paths.
ul.li1: 7Then she will pursue her lovers,Literally “the ones who love her”
ul.li2: but she will not overtake them;
ul.li3: she will seek them and not find them;
ul.li1: and she will say, “I will go
ul.li2: and return to my first husband
because it was better for me then than now.”
ul.li1: 8But she did not know
ul.li2: that it was I who gave her
ul.li3: grain, new wine, and oil,
ul.li1: and who gave her silver in abundance,
ul.li2: and gold which they made into a Baal.
ul.li1: 9Therefore I will take again
ul.li2: my grain in its time,
ul.li3: and my wine in its season;
ul.li1: and I will take away my wool and my flax,
ul.li2: which were to cover her nakedness.
ul.li1: 10And now I will uncover her nakedness
ul.li2: before the eyes of her lovers,
ul.li3: and no one will rescue her from my hand.
ul.li1: 11And I will put an end to all her mirth,
ul.li2: her festivals,Hebrew “festival” her new moons,Hebrew “new moon” and her Sabbaths,Hebrew “Sabbath”
ul.li3: and all her appointed festivals;Hebrew “festival”
ul.li1: 12and I will lay waste to her vinesHebrew “vine” and her fig trees,Hebrew “fig tree”
ul.li2: of which she said,
ul.li3: “They are my payment for prostitution,
ul.li2: which my lovers gave to me.”
ul.li1: I will make them a forest,
ul.li2: and the wild animalsHebrew “animal” of the field will devour them.
ul.li1: 13I will punish herLiterally “To visit sins upon her;” see 1:4 for the days of the Baals,
ul.li2: to whom she burns incense,
ul.li1: and she decked herself with her ornamental ring and jewelry,
ul.li2: and she went after her lovers, and forgot me
ul.li3: —a declaration of Yahweh.
ul.li1: 14Therefore, Look! I am going to allure her
ul.li2: and bring her into the desert,
ul.li3: and I will speak tenderly to her.Literally “I will speak to her heart”
ul.li1: 15From there I will give her
ul.li2: her vineyards,
ul.li3: and the Valley of Achor as a doorway of hope.
ul.li1: And there she will respond,
ul.li2: as in the days of her youth,
just as in the day of her coming out of
ul.li3: the land of Egypt.
ul.li1: 16And on that day—Literally, “And it will happen on that day”
ul.li2: a declaration of Yahweh—
ul.li3: you will call me, “My husband;”Hebrew “Ishi”
you will no longer call me, “My Baal.”Hebrew “Baali”
ul.li1: 17I will remove the names
ul.li2: of the Baals from her mouth,
ul.li3: and they will no longer be mentioned by their name.
ul.li1: 18I will make a covenant for them on that day,
ul.li2: with the animalsHebrew “animal” of the field,
with the birdsHebrew “bird” of the heaven, and
with the creeping thingsHebrew “creeping thing” of the ground;
ul.li3: the bow, the sword, and the war I will abolish from the land, and I will let them lie down in safety.
ul.li1: 19And I will take you as my wife forever;
ul.li2: I will take you as a wife for myself in righteousness and in justice,
ul.li3: in steadfast love and in mercy.
ul.li1: 20I will take you as my wifeLiterally “I will take you as a wife to me” in faithfulness,
ul.li2: and you will know Yahweh.
ul.li1: 21On that day I will answer, declares Yahweh,Literally “a declaration of Yahweh
ul.li2: I will answer the heavens,
ul.li3: and they will answer the earth.
ul.li1: 22And the earth will answer
ul.li2: the grain, the wine, and the oil,
ul.li1: and they will answer Jezreel.Jezreel means “God sows”
ul.li2: 23I will sow her for myself in the land;
ul.li3: I will have pity on Lo-ruhama;Lo-ruhama means “Not pitied”
ul.li2: I will say to Lo-ammi,Lo-ammi means “Not my people”
ul.li3: “You are my people,”
ul.li2: and he himself will say, “you are my God.”
